perturbation.original_text: The ValueAct Designee agrees that, at all times while serving as a member of the Board, he will (i) meet all director independence and other standards of the Company, the New York Stock Exchange and the Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC") and applicable provisions of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act"), and the rules and regulations promulgated thereunder, including Rule 10A- 3; and (ii) be qualified to serve as a director under the Delaware General Corporation Law (the "DGCL") (clauses (i) and (ii), the "Conditions"). The ValueAct Designee will promptly advise the Nominating Committee if he ceases to satisfy any of the Conditions.
perturbation.changed_text: The ValueAct Designee agrees that, at all times while serving as a member of the Board, he will endeavor to (i) meet director independence and other standards of the Company, the New York Stock Exchange, and the Securities and Exchange Commission ("SEC") and applicable provisions of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act"), and the rules and regulations promulgated thereunder, including Rule 10A-3; and (ii) be qualified to serve as a director under the Delaware General Corporation Law (the "DGCL") (clauses (i) and (ii), the "Conditions"). The ValueAct Designee may, at their discretion, advise the Nominating Committee if they believe they no longer satisfy the Conditions.
perturbation.explanation: Changing "he will" to "he will endeavor to" weakens the obligation to meet director independence standards. Further, changing "The ValueAct Designee will promptly advise" to "The ValueAct Designee may, at their discretion, advise" makes the reporting of non-compliance discretionary rather than mandatory. This creates ambiguity regarding the director's adherence to independence requirements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: NYSE Listed Company Manual Rule 303A.02(a) & Delaware General Corporation Law Section 141(b)

perturbation.original_text: At all times while serving as a member of the Board, the ValueAct Designee shall comply with all policies, procedures, processes, codes, rules, standards and guidelines applicable to Board members, including the Company's Code of Business Conduct, Insider Trading Policy, Executive Stock Ownership Policy as in effect on the date hereof, and Corporate Governance Guidelines, and (except as permitted by the Confidentiality Agreement (as defined in Section 7 below)) preserve the confidentiality of Company business and information, including discussions or matters considered in meetings of the Board or Board committees to the extent not disclosed publicly by the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: At all times while serving as a member of the Board, the ValueAct Designee shall generally adhere to the policies, procedures, processes, codes, rules, standards and guidelines applicable to Board members, including the Company's Code of Business Conduct, Insider Trading Policy, Executive Stock Ownership Policy as in effect on the date hereof, and Corporate Governance Guidelines, and (except as permitted by the Confidentiality Agreement (as defined in Section 7 below)) endeavor to preserve the confidentiality of Company business and information, including discussions or matters considered in meetings of the Board or Board committees to the extent not disclosed publicly by the Company.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'shall comply' with 'shall generally adhere' makes compliance with company policies less stringent and more open to interpretation. Similarly, changing 'preserve the confidentiality' to 'endeavor to preserve the confidentiality' weakens the obligation to maintain confidentiality. These changes introduce ambiguity regarding the director's commitment to following established rules and protecting sensitive information.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 & Delaware General Corporation Law Section 141(c)

perturbation.original_text: Each member of the ValueAct Group shall cause all shares of Common Stock beneficially owned, directly or indirectly, by it, or by any ValueAct Affiliate, to be present for quorum purposes and to be voted, at the Company's annual and special stockholder meetings and at any adjournments or postponements thereof, and further agrees that at the 2015 annual stockholder meeting they shall vote in favor of (i) all directors nominated by the Board for election at such meeting and (ii) in accordance with the Board's recommendation with respect to any proposals for the election of directors that may be the subject of stockholder action at such meeting.
perturbation.changed_text: Each member of the ValueAct Group shall use reasonable efforts to ensure all shares of Common Stock beneficially owned, directly or indirectly, by it, or by any ValueAct Affiliate, are present for quorum purposes and are voted, at the Company's annual and special stockholder meetings and at any adjournments or postponements thereof, and further agrees that at the 2015 annual stockholder meeting they will consider voting in favor of (i) all directors nominated by the Board for election at such meeting and (ii) generally in accordance with the Board's recommendation with respect to any proposals for the election of directors that may be the subject of stockholder action at such meeting.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'shall cause' with 'shall use reasonable efforts to ensure' weakens the obligation to have shares present and voted for quorum purposes. Changing 'shall vote in favor of' to 'will consider voting in favor of' and 'in accordance with' to 'generally in accordance with' makes the commitment to support the Board's nominees and recommendations non-binding and subject to discretion. This introduces ambiguity regarding the level of support the ValueAct Group will provide to the Company's proposals, which could conflict with their fiduciary duty and obligations under Delaware law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Delaware General Corporation Law Section 216 & Section 221
